title: Contributor Code of Conduct
text: contributors maintainers project, pledge respect people contribute reporting issues, posting feature requests, updating documentation, submitting pull requests patches, activities. committed making participation project harassment-free experience everyone, regardless level experience, gender, gender identity expression, sexual orientation, disability, personal appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, religion. Examples unacceptable behavior participants include use sexual language imagery, derogatory comments personal attacks, trolling, public private harassment, insults, unprofessional conduct. Project maintainers right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct. Project maintainers follow Code Conduct may removed project team. Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported opening issue contacting one project maintainers. Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant (http:contributor-covenant.org), version 1.0.0, available http://contributor-covenant.org/version/1/0/0/

title: MIDFIELD Data Sample
text: ‘midfielddata’ provides anonymized student-level data approximately 98,000 undergraduates three US institutions 1988 2018. Data organized four tables keyed student ID. Practice data tables ‘midfielddata’. Student-level data refers information collected undergraduate institutions individual students, including: course information course name, number, type, credit hours, student grades term information year term, program, academic standing, grade point average student demographic information age, sex, race/ethnicity, standardized test scores degree information institution, program, term, baccalaureate degree

title: MIDFIELD Data Sample
text: Data tables can loaded individually needed. Alternatively, several data tables can loaded .
code: # Load individual data tables data(student, package = "midfielddata") data(term,    package = "midfielddata") data(course,  package = "midfielddata") data(degree,  package = "midfielddata") # Load multiple tables at once  data(student, course, term, degree, package = "midfielddata")

title: MIDFIELD Data Sample
text: use ‘data.table’ throughout compact syntax. use optional, though one modify examples accommodate different data manipulation syntax base ‘R’ ‘dplyr’. illustrate data structure, can examine student-level data one specific student. student data table contains one observation per student. select subset columns less cluttered printout.
code: # Package useful for data manipulation library(data.table) # One student ID mcid_we_want <- "MCID3112192438" # Select specific columns cols_we_want <- c("mcid", "institution", "transfer", "race", "sex", "age_desc")  # All observations for this ID  student[mcid == mcid_we_want, .SD, .SDcols = cols_we_want] #>              mcid   institution              transfer   race    sex age_desc #>            <char>        <char>                <char> <char> <char>   <char> #> 1: MCID3112192438 Institution C First-Time in College  White Female Under 25

title: MIDFIELD Data Sample
text: remaining excerpts illustrate block-record structure data, , information one student ID several rows. course data table, example, one row per student per course per term. student enrolled 47 courses Fall 2005 Spring 2009.

title: MIDFIELD Data Sample
text: term data table one observation per student per term. student enrolled 10 consecutive terms, changing majors (row 2, cip6 variable) changing back.
code: # Select specific columns cols_we_want <- c("mcid", "term", "cip6", "level", "standing", "gpa_cumul")  # All observations for this ID  term[mcid == mcid_we_want, .SD, .SDcols = cols_we_want] #>               mcid   term   cip6              level      standing gpa_cumul #>             <char> <char> <char>             <char>        <char>     <num> #>  1: MCID3112192438  20051 451101      01 First-year Good Standing      3.80 #>  2: MCID3112192438  20053 190701      01 First-year Good Standing      3.63 #>  3: MCID3112192438  20061 451101     02 Second-year Good Standing      3.49 #>  4: MCID3112192438  20063 451101     02 Second-year Good Standing      3.54 #>  5: MCID3112192438  20071 451101      03 Third-year Good Standing      3.58 #>  6: MCID3112192438  20073 451101      03 Third-year Good Standing      3.54 #>  7: MCID3112192438  20081 451101      03 Third-year Good Standing      3.58 #>  8: MCID3112192438  20083 451101     04 Fourth-year Good Standing      3.61 #>  9: MCID3112192438  20091 451101     04 Fourth-year Good Standing      3.65 #> 10: MCID3112192438  20093 451101 05 Fifth-year Plus Good Standing      3.68

title: MIDFIELD Data Sample
text: degree data table one observation per student per degree. student earned double degree Psychology Sociology, thus two observations ID. students one degree earn term. example, next student earned degree Biological Sciences 1996 second baccalaureate degree Animal Biology 1999. analyses, first baccalaureate degree used.
code: # Select specific columns  cols_we_want <- c("mcid", "term_degree", "cip6", "degree")  # All observations for this ID  degree[mcid == mcid_we_want, .SD, .SDcols = cols_we_want] #>              mcid term_degree   cip6                            degree #>            <char>      <char> <char>                            <char> #> 1: MCID3112192438       20093 420101 Bachelor of Science in Psychology #> 2: MCID3112192438       20093 451101     Bachelor of Arts in Sociology # All observations for this ID  degree[mcid == "MCID3111315508", .SD, .SDcols = cols_we_want] #>              mcid term_degree   cip6                                     degree #>            <char>      <char> <char>                                     <char> #> 1: MCID3111315508       19961 260101 Bachelor of Science in Biological Sciences #> 2: MCID3111315508       19994 260701      Bachelor of Science in Animal Biology

title: MIDFIELD Data Sample
text: installed size ‘midfielddata’ 24 Mb. exceeds CRAN package limit (5 Mb), host package MIDFIELD’s ‘drat’ repository. Also size, installation takes time. Install :

title: MIDFIELD Data Sample
text: MIDFIELD database , October 2022, contains individual student-level data 1.7M undergraduates 19 US institutions 1987 2018. Access MIDFIELD research database currently limited MIDFIELD partner institutions, sample data available ‘midfielddata’. ‘midfielddata’ proportionate stratified sample MIDFIELD database. However, MIDFIELD used education research, ‘midfielddata’ practice data, suitable drawing inferences program attributes student experiences. ‘midfieldr’ companion ‘R’ package provides tools detailed procedures working MIDFIELD data.

title: Course data sample — course
text: Course information approximately 98,000 undergraduates. One record per student per course per term, keyed student ID.

title: Course data sample — course
text: data.frame data.table 12 variables approximately 3.3M observations 97,555 unique students occupying 325 MB memory: mcid Character, anonymized student identifier, e.g., "MCID3111142225". institution Character, anonymized institution name, e.g., "Institution B". term_course Character, academic year term, format "YYYYT". course Character, course name, e.g., "Astrophysics III", "Calculus Social Science Business", "Corp Financial Rprtng 1", "Environmental Sanitation II", "Fitness Wellness", "Introductory Astronomy 2", "Changing Environment", etc. abbrev Character, course alpha identifier, e.g. "AA", "MATH", "ACCT", "EH", "HES", "ASTR", etc. number Character, course numeric identifier, e.g. "1104", "1209", "228", "4047", etc. section Character, course section identifier, one four characters, e.g., "1", "2", "01", "14", "001", "040", "785", "H02", "R01", "300E", "888R", etc. type Character, predominant delivery method section, e.g., "Blended", "Distance Education", "Face--Face", "Online", etc. faculty_rank Character, academic rank person teaching course, e.g., "Assistant Professor", "Associate Professor", "Graduate Assistant", "Visiting Faculty", etc. hours_course Numeric, number credit-hours successful course completion. grade Character, course grade, e.g., "+", "", "-", "B+", "", "NG", etc. discipline_midfield Character, variable grouping courses academic discipline assigned MIDFIELD data curator, e.g., "Anthropology", "Business", "Computer Science", "Engineering", "Language Literature", "Mathematics", "Visual Performing Arts", etc.

title: Course data sample — course
text: Data provided MIDFIELD project: https://midfield.online/

title: Course data sample — course
text: Terms encoded YYYYT, YYYY year start academic year T encodes semester quarter within academic year Fall (1), Winter (2), Spring (3), Summer (4, 5, 6). example, academic year 1995--96, Fall 95--96 encoded 19951, Spring 95--96 encoded 19953, first Summer 95-96 term encoded 19954. source database includes special month-long sessions encoded letters , B, C, etc., though none included sample. data 'midfielddata' practice data, suitable learning work Student Unit Records (SURs) generally. Unlike MIDFIELD research database, data tables 'midfielddata' research data; suitable drawing inferences program attributes student experiences.

title: Degree data sample — degree
text: Degree information approximately 50,000 undergraduates earning degrees. One record per student per degree, keyed student ID. subset 98,000 undergraduates practice data.

title: Degree data sample — degree
text: data.frame data.table 5 variables 49,543 observations unique students occupying 6 MB memory: mcid Character, anonymized student identifier, e.g., "MCID3111142225". institution Character, anonymized institution name, e.g., "Institution B". term_degree Character, academic year term, format "YYYYT", student completes program. cip6 Character, 6-digit CIP code program student earns degree, e.g., "090101", "141201", "260901", "420101", etc. degree Character, type degree awarded, e.g., "Bachelor Arts Geography", "Bachelor Science Finance", etc.

title: Degree data sample — degree
text: Data provided MIDFIELD project: https://midfield.online/ CIP codes adapted NCES IPEDS: https://nces.ed.gov/ipeds/cipcode/

title: Degree data sample — degree
text: Terms encoded YYYYT, YYYY year start academic year T encodes semester quarter within academic year Fall (1), Winter (2), Spring (3), Summer (4, 5, 6). example, academic year 1995--96, Fall 95--96 encoded 19951, Spring 95--96 encoded 19953, first Summer 95-96 term encoded 19954. source database includes special month-long sessions encoded letters , B, C, etc., though none included sample. program codes, 'midfielddata' uses 2010 version Classification Instructional Programs (CIP). 'midfieldr' installed, type help(cip, package = "midfieldr") details. data 'midfielddata' practice data, suitable learning work Student Unit Records (SURs) generally. Unlike MIDFIELD research database, data tables 'midfielddata' research data; suitable drawing inferences program attributes student experiences.

title: MIDFIELD Data Sample — midfielddata-package
text: Provides data sample practice working individual undergraduate student unit records (registrar's data) 'R'. Data organized four data tables --- student, course, term, degree --- providing anonymized records approximately 98,000 students three US institutions 1988 2018, keyed student ID. data proportionate stratified sample MIDFIELD database. However, unlike MIDFIELD data, data 'midfielddata' suitable drawing inferences program attributes student experiences --- practice data, research data.

title: MIDFIELD Data Sample — midfielddata-package
text: Data provided MIDFIELD: https://midfield.online/.

title: MIDFIELD Data Sample — midfielddata-package
text: MIDFIELD database containing (October, 2022) individual Student Unit Records (SURs) 1.7M undergraduate students 19 US institutions 1987 2018. Access MIDFIELD research database currently limited MIDFIELD partner institutions, sample data available 'midfielddata' package. 'midfieldr' companion 'R' package provides tools detailed procedures working MIDFIELD research data 'midfielddata' practice data. work supported grant US National Science Foundation (EEC 1545667).

title: Student data sample — student
text: Demographic information matriculation approximately 98,000 degree-seeking undergraduate students. One record per student, keyed student ID.

title: Student data sample — student
text: data.frame data.table 13 variables 97,555 observations unique students occupying 18 MB memory: mcid Character, anonymized student identifier, e.g., "MCID3111142225". institution Character, anonymized institution name, e.g., "Institution B". transfer Character, transfer status, possible values "First-Time College", "First-Time Transfer". hours_transfer Numeric, number credit hours transferred (NA). race Character, race/ethnicity, e.g., "Asian", "Black", "International", "Latine", etc. sex Character, sex, possible values "Female", "Male", "Unknown". age_desc Character, age group, possible values "25 Older", "25". us_citizen Character, US citizenship, possible values "", "Yes". home_zip Character, home ZIP code (NA), e.g., "02056", "20170", "51301", "80129", etc. high_school Character, code last high school attended admission (NA), e.g., "060075", "210512", "431800", "502195", etc. sat_math Numeric, SAT mathematics test score (NA). sat_verbal Numeric, SAT reading test score (NA). act_comp Numeric, ACT composite test score (NA).

title: Student data sample — student
text: Data provided MIDFIELD project: https://midfield.online/

title: Student data sample — student
text: data 'midfielddata' practice data, suitable learning work Student Unit Records (SURs) generally. Unlike MIDFIELD research database, data tables 'midfielddata' research data; suitable drawing inferences program attributes student experiences.

title: Term data sample — term
text: Term information approximately 98,000 undergraduates. One record per student per enrolled term, keyed student ID.

title: Term data sample — term
text: data.frame data.table 13 variables approximately 640,000 observations 97,555 unique students occupying 73 MB memory: mcid Character, anonymized student identifier, e.g., "MCID3111142225". institution Character, anonymized institution name, e.g., "Institution B". term Character, academic year term, format "YYYYT". cip6 Character, 6-digit CIP code program student enrolled term, e.g., "090101", "141201", "260901", "420101", etc. level Character, academic level determined cumulative number credit earned, e.g., "01 First-year", "02 Second-year", etc. standing Character, academic standing, e.g., "Good Standing", "Academic Warning", etc. coop Character, cooperative education term, possible values "Yes", "." hours_term Numeric, credit hours earned term. hours_term_attempt Numeric, credit hours attempted term. hours_cumul Numeric, cumulative credit hours earned. hours_cumul_attempt Numeric, cumulative credit hours attempted. gpa_term Numeric, term grade point average. gpa_cumul Numeric, cumulative grade point average.

title: Term data sample — term
text: Data provided MIDFIELD project: https://midfield.online/ CIP codes adapted NCES IPEDS: https://nces.ed.gov/ipeds/cipcode/

title: Term data sample — term
text: Terms encoded YYYYT, YYYY year start academic year T encodes semester quarter within academic year Fall (1), Winter (2), Spring (3), Summer (4, 5, 6). example, academic year 1995--96, Fall 95--96 encoded 19951, Spring 95--96 encoded 19953, first Summer 95-96 term encoded 19954. source database includes special month-long sessions encoded letters , B, C, etc., though none included sample. program codes, 'midfielddata' uses 2010 version Classification Instructional Programs (CIP).  'midfieldr' installed, type help(cip, package = "midfieldr") details. data 'midfielddata' practice data, suitable learning work Student Unit Records (SURs) generally. Unlike MIDFIELD research database, data tables 'midfielddata' research data; suitable drawing inferences program attributes student experiences.

title: midfielddata 0.2.0 (2022-12)
